definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]

sentences.english: We have only two double rooms available but they are on different floors.
sentences.chinese: 我们只剩下两间双人房，但在不同的楼层。

sentences.english: "Save us", read a banner hung from one of the upper floor windows.
sentences.chinese: “救救我们”，较高楼层的窗户上挂出这样的横幅。

sentences.english: The whole building has nine floors of guest rooms 220 rooms.
sentences.chinese: 全楼客房有九个楼层共220间房。

sentences.english: On every floor there is a fire hydrant.
sentences.chinese: 每个楼层都有一个消防栓。

sentences.english: If can consider to allocate from other floors if there is not have enough staff.
sentences.chinese: 人员不足可以考虑从其他楼层调配。

sentences.english: Better yet, climb the stairs between hallway laps.
sentences.chinese: 更好的话，可以爬爬楼层间的楼梯。

sentences.english: When the height of storey is not higher than 4M, Fixed parts can be installed on riser.
sentences.chinese: 楼层高度小于或等于4M时，立管可装一个固定件。

sentences.english: The decoration of the hotel is dignity and elegance.
sentences.chinese: 酒店装修高贵典雅，有直达电梯到各楼层。

sentences.english: At least 1 year working experience in 4-star hotel;
sentences.chinese: 一年以上四星级酒店管家部楼层房务员工作经验。

sentences.english: Heavy masonry infills start immediately above the commercial floor.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的砌面填料马上压向商用楼层。

sentences.english: The atlantes and caryatids also appear to evolve towards the uppermost floors of the towers.
sentences.chinese: 这些男像柱和女像柱都朝向塔楼最高的楼层。

sentences.english: The entire floor of this level is ceramic.
sentences.chinese: 这个楼层的整个地板都是陶瓷材料。

sentences.english: The hotel provides non-smoking floor and specially designed rooms for disabled guests.
sentences.chinese: 酒店还设有不吸烟楼层和残疾人房间。

sentences.english: May I ask which floor you prefer?
sentences.chinese: 请问你比较喜欢哪些楼层？

sentences.english: There is no door closing button. Press any floor button to close the landing door.
sentences.chinese: 这里没有关门按掣，按下任何楼层按钮以关闭机门。

sentences.english: To my surprise, we got off at the same floor.
sentences.chinese: 令我惊奇的是，我们下了车在同一楼层。

definition: top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
top floor/the top of a building
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
